title: Drawing, "Wallpaper Design", 1835–50
medium: Brush and gouache, graphite on white paper
markings: Lower margin, in graphite: NTL N2 Mittere; in ink, upper left: 2tenZ [?] F. Rühl [?]; lower left: W; in graphite, upper right: GW
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mary Hearn Greims
description: A dado is shown at the bottom, and a high entablature on top. The panel is rose, and divided into stripes by vertical rows of palmettes. Two alternative suggestions are made for the white motifs decorating the stripes: lozenge motifs connected by curved boughs and complicated motifs consisting of rosettes, halves of petals, leaf boughs. On top is an oak garland, the upper part of which is shown against a dark background.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Wallpaper Design", 1835–50. Brush and gouache, graphite on white paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mary Hearn Greims. 1940-120-51.
